title: The Quiet Might of Walter Wood

story.text: Walter Wood discovers his latent power of energy manipulation while meditating beside his favorite oak tree. The initially unintentional pulse of energy revitalizes the dying flora around him.

Intrigued by his newfound ability, Walter practices in his backyard, learning to focus his energy through his painted landscapes which come to life momentarily, breathing a gust of wind or a beam of sunlight into the room.
A local disturbance in the park led Walter to discreetly use his powers; a tree nearly falls on a group of picnickers, but he stabilizes and re-roots it effortlessly, unseen by others.
Word of these minor miracles spreads inadvertently. Walter receives a visit from a young woman asking for help to revive her family’s withered orchard.
Walter and the young woman spend the day at the orchard. With his guidance, she learns to channel some of his energy, and together they manage to rejuvenate the wilted trees.
News of the revived orchard spreads, piquing the curiosity of the community, but Walter remains a humble, enigmatic savior, unwilling to take credit and shying away from the limelight.
Walter spends a quiet day at home, painting a vibrant scene of the orchard’s recovery, meditating on the week’s unforeseen adventures and the positive impact of his powers.

ending: As the sun set, Walter smiled, knowing that even the quietest among us can resonate with the strength of a mighty storm.
moral: True power lies in serenity and the will to do good, irrespective of age or acclaim.
